comment: Very enthusiastic, she comes ready to explain anything you don't understand. Attendance is graded so show up for the grade, but if you just read the powerpoint lectures, you'll be okay. The quizzes aren't difficult, just keep up with the reading. Study quiz questions and answers for tests! Not a super difficult class- just do the work and show up.

If you enjoy homework, this is the class for you. If not then I wouldn't recommend it.  You only have to complete so many out of the total homework assignments. She takes a long time to grade, though, and ended up grading the last few assignments for completion instead of content. Show up, pay attention, and you'll pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This class isn't an EASY A, but you should get an A if you attend class regularly and study the power points. Nothing about the subject is difficult, you just have to turn in the one page papers. The film paper was so simple. And I got over a 100 on the final by just studying her PowerPoints. She does take centuries to put in grades though.

Dr. Russel is is very clear of what she expects. There are 22 CPA opportunities and you have to turn in at least 15 (they are one page responses to the readings and should be easy A's). The film review towards the end is worth 20% of your grade (easy A if you follow the rubric). She is SUPER lecture heavy and goes in depth.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Honestly the worst professor I have ever had.  She takes forever to grade anything, has the worst voice I've ever had to listen to, and give you a "review" for tests that is absolutely pointless. Do yourself a favor a do not take
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I LOVED the material and the textbook she chose for class. Those 1 page papers did get super annoying, but you only have to do 15 out of 22. If you study the power points, you should make an A. Without a doubt. The books are just resources and for the writings. This isn't an easy A but it's definitely possible if you try.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I liked this class a lot! I don't think her voice is high-pitched but she can get loud, that's better than not being able to hear her though. A ton of one page papers, attendance is graded, a midterm, and one actual paper. You will have to work for your grade but overall the class and subject was enjoyable. I'd take her again.

I find it weird that there are so many iffy reviews. She's great. She does refrain from using gender pronouns because she doesn't want to offend or mislabel. She teaches from a sociologists perspective, not so much biased. Use the PPTs for studying, you'll make the A. 15 one page papers on readings assigned. Midterm. Film review paper. Final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Just read the powerpoints. Tests are easy. Have to write 20 one page papers they are really not difficult. She is a pretty good teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Homework consists of 15 assigned one page papers due over the readings .Midterm, final, and film review paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She has a very high pitched voice and laughs at her own jokes that aren't remotely funny. We have 1 page papers due every class over different readings and it sounds like a lot but it's really not. Her only tests are a midterm and final. She gives you a study guide but it's not helpful at all. Attendance is mandatory but get someone to sign you in.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I dropped out of her class as soon as I could. You have to read a chapter a night plus more and then write a page paper every night. Her voice is annoying because it is very high pitched. She reads straight off the powerpoint. Attendance is mandatory. She asks what pronoun you like to go by. Teaches her opinions about gender discrimination.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This class is long. You would be better off reading the PowerPoint AGAIN after going over it in class, because she will go in to GREAT detail. She will also tell awkward jokes in beween it all. Not a bad teacher overall however you have to write a page paper everyday so be prepared for that. Attendance DOES count.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I was in this class for about 4 class periods, and this is by far the most interesting professor I've ever met. She refused to use gender pronouns (he, she, etc) she claims to be gender neutral since it puts "labels" on people. We have to write a paper every single class, and it's strictly lecture. DONT RECOMMEND.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS
